title: HomeAway
tableData: VrboAustin Business Journal. "Vacation rental site lands $160M, buys competitor", Austin Business Journal November 13, 2006.
Vrbo, also known as 'Vacation Rentals by Owner' and previously styled as 'VRBO', was founded in 1995 as a service for short term rental listings. It was acquired by HomeAway in 2006.
Abritel.fr*Austin Business Journal. "HomeAway buys French Web site", Austin Business Journal January 22, 2007.

RealHolidays.com.auTechCrunch."HomeAway Broadens Presence In Australia With Acquisition Of Vacation Rental Site RealHolidays", Leena Rao April 4, 2011.
Toprural.comTheNextWeb."HomeAway acquires Spainâ€™s rural tourism site Toprural in all-cash deal", The Next Web April 2, 2012.

This social networking site for accommodation and room rentals was founded in Singapore in 2012. Receiving US$1 million in funding in 2012, by late 2013 travelmob had an iOS app, and a distribution agreement with Wego.com. In May 2015, travelmob transitioned its brand and products to HomeAway.
Stayz AustraliaMarket Watch."HomeAway Acquires Australia's Leading Vacation Rental Group, Stayz", December 4, 2013.

Dwellable was a mobile app and website founded in 2012 in Seattle, which had over 300,000 vacation rental listings by 2014, and had raised $2 million in funding. Originally in private ownership, it was bought by HomeAway in 2015 for $18 million.
